content.description: Another forgotten route on the Painted Boulder.  Can be done as either: sport, top-rope, or as a high ball boulder problem.  Starts on the West face of the Painted boulder and moves up on the left side of a seam with a couple of large jugs down low and a blank section in the middle followed by a positive ledge and two finger pocket up high.
content.location: Follow the foot trails up the hill from the secondary face to a large boulder with a lot of graffiti on it.  The route is on the west side of the boulder, but to the right of the arête that has Airless Spray Route on it.

content.description: This is a short and probably forgotten route up on the painted boulder high on the hill.  Starts to the left of the arête with a sit start and moves up the ledges to a balancy stance as you move up the arête.  Could be done as a boulder high ball problem, but the landing is on a pretty sloped hill.
content.protection: 3 bolts to chains.  Can walk off the top, but the top of the boulder is covered in lichen and the holds are far between.
content.location: follow the foot trails up the hill from the secondary face to a boulder with a lot of graffiti on it.  The route is on the left side of an arête on the west side of the boulder.
